result.execSummary:
The defendant Uruba Lumpkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Uruba Lumpkins
Current: 3410 West Lisbon Avenue #406, Milwaukee, WI 53208-1948 United States  (Effective: 02-19-2015)
Prior: 930 N Springfield, Chicago, IL 60651 United States

Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction-straight time, with credit for 41 DAYS time served.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments by 9/12/14; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge by 9/12/14; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
$25 restitution to Justice Point by 9/12/14; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting
Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement (copy given to defendant);
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  kmw

Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  kmw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in custody.  Paul Hauer for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in court with Zachariah Fudge who appears under the student practice rule and under the supervision of attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
